attributes.action: Enforce NHS services to follow the Equality act when it comes to mask exemptions
attributes.additional_details: To ensure that the NHS aligns itself and any national and/or local policies written up surrounding mask wearing comply fully with the Equality Act.
attributes.background: Many who have mask exeptions are finding it difficult to access NHS services whether that be thier local GP or specialist services. This is a breach of the Equality Act sections 112 and 119 and potentially the Disabilty Discrimination act also.

rejection.details:
The Government is responsible for setting the rules on when people must use face coverings, but ensuring that people exempt from these requirements are treated fairly is a matter for individual organisations, including NHS trusts.

If you have been refused service then you should complain directly to the NHS. You can find out how to do this here: https://www.nhs.uk/using-the-nhs/about-the-nhs/how-to-complain-to-the-nhs/
